abstract: Returns a format that represents the highest fidelity that the current device supports.
overview:
## Return Value

An initialized format.

## Discussion

The returned format object always represents the device’s highest fidelity, regardless of the actual fidelity currently employed by the device. A graphics renderer uses this method to create a format at initialization time if you use an initializer that does not have a format argument.

This property doesn’t always return a format that’s optimized for the current configuration of the main screen. If you’re rendering content for immediate display, it’s recommended that you use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsRendererFormat/preferred()] instead of this property.

# default()

**Type Method**

Returns a format that represents the highest fidelity that the current device supports.

## Declaration

```swift
class func `default`() -> Self
```

## Return Value

An initialized format.

## Discussion

The returned format object always represents the device’s highest fidelity, regardless of the actual fidelity currently employed by the device. A graphics renderer uses this method to create a format at initialization time if you use an initializer that does not have a format argument.

This property doesn’t always return a format that’s optimized for the current configuration of the main screen. If you’re rendering content for immediate display, it’s recommended that you use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsRendererFormat/preferred()] instead of this property.

## Creating a format

- **preferred()**: Returns the most suitable format for the main screen’s current configuration.

items.description: Returns the most suitable format for the main screen’s current configuration.
